meanings.definition: To wear out or exhaust through constant use or excessive activity.
meanings.sent1: She outwore her favorite shoes by walking in them every day.
meanings.sent2: The old bicycle finally outwore after years of daily rides.
meanings.sent3: He outwore his welcome by staying too long at the party.
meanings.sent4: The constant stress outwore her patience like a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending chores outwore her energy, leaving her exhausted.

meanings.definition: To surpass in wearing out or exhausting.
meanings.sent1: The new treadmill quickly outwore the old one in terms of durability.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm for the project outwore that of his teammates.
meanings.sent3: The race car outwore all its competitors, leaving them in the dust.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her craft outwore any obstacles that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The champion boxer outwore his opponent with his superior skills.
